conclusion: Several identical small steel balls released from a position on an inclined plane every 0.1 seconds without initial velocity.
Photograph taken of several small steel balls rolling on the inclined plane.
Measured distances are AB = 15 cm and BC = 20 cm with a 1:1 scale relationship.
Several small steel balls rolling on top of ball A.
Image shows steel balls labeled A, B, and C on an inclined plane with distances AB = 15 cm and BC = 20 cm.
Steel balls released every 0.1 seconds, so time intervals between them are 0.1 seconds.
Ball A is at the starting position, Ball C is 0.3 seconds later (three intervals).
Distance traveled by Ball C in 0.3 seconds is 35 cm (AB + BC).
Using kinematic equation \(s = ut +  rac{1}{2}at^2\) with \(s = 35\), \(u = 0\), \(t = 0.3\).
Calculated acceleration corresponds to average acceleration of balls on inclined plane.
